intro: Nabaluia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf nabaluia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
